intro: Marginaria someyae f. awaense, commonly known as the Awa endemic margarida, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within montane forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
